meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a eukaryote.
meanings.sent1: The eukaryotic cell has a well-defined nucleus.
meanings.sent2: Plants and animals are examples of eukaryotic organisms.
meanings.sent3: It's like the eukaryotic cells are the fancy mansions of the biological world.
meanings.sent4: Her eukaryotic nature shone brightly in the sea of prokaryotic beings.
meanings.sent5: The eukaryotic structure of the cell resembled a bustling city with its nucleus as the central command center.

meanings.definition: Having cells with a true nucleus.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the eukaryotic organisms under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The eukaryotic cells were throwing a party in their nucleus!
meanings.sent4: In the world of cells, eukaryotic ones are like having a secure vault for genetic material.
meanings.sent5: The eukaryotic nucleus stood proudly at the center of the cell, like a king on a throne.
